info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 11:59PM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Granite and southwestern Powell Counties through 1245 AM MDT... At 1159 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles northwest of Philipsburg, or 20 miles southwest of Drummond, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half-inch size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Drummond, Maxville, Jens, Brock Creek, New Chicago, Bearmouth, Goldcreek and Hall. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 141 and 167. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
